TopicTitle: would you want to be a kerbal?

Articles.Content:
Hello everyone I am Penguinhero AKA The man with a poll addiction! Today todays poll is would you want to be a kerbal? This pole will not show your username so keep that in mind. Please remember to use the poll. If you want to put your answer in the comments, fine but you must use the poll as well. Don't forget to look at the forums the day after tomorrow between 1pm and 2pm Est for another poll.

CHEERS!

posted 7/6/13
And having a life expectancy of 2 minutes? erm....no...
Well, so long as I can be in Scott Manley's save file (AKA not be killed every 10 minutes), okay.
Only if I don't have to fly in a rocket and get blown up after 2 minutes.

Hmm, I wouldn't want to be a Kerbal because of two things:

1. Humans have a higher life expectancy

2. Humans have noses.
Maybe, if i can be reincarnated like in KSP, sure.
Kerbal, perhaps... But maybe not a Kerbalnaut... Not unless I get some SERIOUS say in the testing and simulation protocols.
Well, at least I'd know how I was going to die.

Pros:

-if you die, you come back

-there is no need to eat, drink, or breath therefore greatly reducing costs

-no whacky laws to hold you back from doing kerbal things...you know what I mean.

-radiation-tolerant

Cons:

-in most cases you die like every 20 minutes

-even if you aren't a pilot and are just a civilian there is a 90% your house gets crushed by a tank when you come home from the market

-if you are a pilot you will most likely be controlled by a mad dictator

-Jebediah
I prefer being human, although, they all are generally the same height, and being 16, and 6'3" has restricted me from doing anything that goes into tight corners.

Well my answer to this depends on how you state the question...

Do I want to be a Kerbal in the sense that I get to discover new things, have my footprints be the first on other worlds, pilot creations beyond my dreams, survive ridiculous catastrophes and walk it off with a smile and never have to maintain my body (honestly, food?)... then, yes.

However...

Do I want to die all the time, get stuck in orbit forever without fuel and know nobody's coming(I won't die because FOOD, HONESTLY ), spend years on the surface of another world for a rescue that will ultumitally strand me in Kerbin's oceans and then simply get deleted? Well...no.
Nope, I still love being a human although sometimes I forgot how to human
I'm not a huge fan of dying a horrible fiery death. I pick human.

I'm just fine with being a human who gets to play with his kerbals.

But I do wish my fellow humans were more kerbal-like in their ambitions to explore space.
Only if I get to be one of the engineers in the VAB.

Not a kerbal, nar.

All respect to them though, they are fun to hang with.
As long as I don't fly space planes. Those have a higher fatality rate then rockets. At least for myself.

I too would like to be a Kerbal. Or atleast live on Kerbin. They get all the cool space explorers, and we have... some satellites and an ISS. Sure we've been to the Moon, but are we going back? No. Have we been to other planets? No. You know why? Because Governments would rather spend billions on researching why people are fat or why cars are killing the planet instead of spending billions to put Man on another planet.
Humans have noses and pee-pees whereas kerbals don't. That is all i need to say

Only if I get to be one of the engineers in the VAB.

As if that place is safe! I love aiming rockets at it.

As if that place is safe! I love aiming rockets at it.

Not only that. The stuff they are building might explode onthem anyways.
Other than their immortality regardless of never eating, sleeping or..well... doing anything but awaiting doom - I think I'll pass.

Of course, my life would be short but fantastic.

Maybe a little sexless.

82% of Kerbal Losses last year were linked to insanity

Upon further investigation, it was found that a Lone Kerbal whom develops an itch on the top of their head will be driven insane within hours

I like being able to reach my head

and therefore I would prefer to stay Human
It would depend on who's at ground control, pushing the wasd keys...
